dt: {bc}to remove (something, such as chaff) by a current of air
{bc}to get rid of (something undesirable or unwanted) {bc}{sx|remove||}

dt.t: an old hand at {wi}winnowing{/wi} what is true and significant

dt: {bc}to treat (something, such as grain) by exposure to a current of air so that waste matter is eliminated
{bc}to free of unwanted or inferior elements {bc}{sx|pare||}

dt.t: the wind {wi}winnowing{/wi} his thin white hair

dt: {bc}to separate chaff from grain by fanning

et: Middle English {it}winewen{/it}, from Old English {it}windwian{/it} to fan, winnow; akin to Old High German {it}wintōn{/it} to fan, Latin {it}vannus{/it} winnowing fan, {it}ventus{/it} wind {ma}{mat|wind:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to remove (something, such as chaff) by a current of air
to get rid of (something undesirable or unwanted) : remove —often used with out
